Cute.

oh, you have Group 7 access, don't you?

Ok

(sighs) Sherman, set the Wayback Machine for...oh, 1973. Kevin Flynn (points to himself) is one of the brightest young software engineers at ICOM. He's so bright that he starts going in there at night, and sets up a private memory file, and begins writing a program for a video game he is inventing, called... Another software engineer -- not so young, not so bright, but very, very sneaky. One night, our boy Flynn goes to his terminal, tries to read up his file, and ... nothing. A big blank. We now take you to three months later. Ed Dillinger presents ICOM with five video games he has "invented" -- the slime didn't even change the names -- and he gets a big fat promotion. Thus begins his meteoric rise to...what is he now, Executive V.P.?
Senior exec.

Because somewhere... in one of those memories ... is the evidence. If I got in far enough, I could reconstruct it.
My password ... Dillinger's instruction to divert the data ...

Dillinger?

Don't even say that. You've got to find that file before he does..
